website_summaries.verdict: This helmet is ideal for TIG welding, but also has a grinding mode. More versatile than the entry-level helmets it often replaces. We recommend keeping spare batteries on hand, but the electronic features are top notch in operation.
pros: Will accommodate a magnifying lens to improve visibility
Electronic darkness and delay adjustments are very precise
Headgear and "flip-down" hood are well balanced
cons: 3 sensors, not 4, can allow arc flash to enter lens
Some describe plastic housing as thin and flimsy

customer_reviews.title: uneven darkness not suitable for precision tig welding
customer_reviews.text: For the money this hood is not worth it. When dark the lens is very uneven as far as darkness. Trying to take the 3g sch5 sanitary weld test you need to see the seam you are welding and the puddle, using this hood depending on how you turn your head it goes from light to dark to light. Luckily i had my old school fixed lens #9 helmet with me, saved the day.
customer_reviews.author: Leland

customer_reviews.title: I'm a beginner, but the helmet is not
customer_reviews.text: just started hobby MIG welding (with a Hobart 140) and this helmet is great. Fits well, great field of visibility and easy settings for darkness, delay, etc. I would suggest wearing some other type of hat/head covering under this as you will get a random spark/metal spray on the back of your head every now and then. If your sight is not all that great or you just want a little help seeing in the dark environment, I would also suggest that you buy some magnifier lens. I put a Hobart 770276 200x in mine and it really helped.

customer_reviews.text: At first glance, it looks badass, but when you put it on, for a welding helmet, its is like heaven on your head, the head band sinches perfectly and holds, when you flip the hood up it stays like it should and it is balanced to a point. But the real deal, how it does to the arc, its instant,you can control the speed (delay) and how sensitive it is to the surrounding light and what triggers its response. The only flaw is i think it should 4 sensors because sometimes it doesnt catch all the arc and it doesnt react if your turned sightly!

customer_reviews.title: The Hobart hat is so much more comfortable, has better electronic adjustments
customer_reviews.text: What a difference!!! I had a much cheaper "hat" before, and although it did all right, it wasn't all I needed. The Hobart hat is so much more comfortable, has better electronic adjustments, and makes it so much easier to see. It was especially nice that I could put in a magnifying lens accessory that made it possible for me to weld without using a pair of reading glasses. WHAT A DIFFERENCE!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet for a DIY welder or backup mask for a pro
customer_reviews.text: I really like the strap adjustments on this mask. Once you get it set the visibility is excellent. I've only owned inexpensive auto-darkening masks before so this one is really a step up for me. I like the fact that the batteries are replaceable and it has several adjustments: shade level, sensitivity, delay (after weld finish), and a reset / test button.
